RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLESTON RACE 1 2 1/16M Hurdle CR: N/A. Maiden Claiming Purse 15000. TO BE RUN OVER NATIONAL FENCES FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three-year-olds, 144 lbs.; four-year-olds, 152 lbs.; older, 156 lbs. Claiming price $15,000. For each $2,500 to $10,000, allowed 4 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PROPHETS VOICE (IRE) chased the leader through the opening half mile, challenged on the outside headed into the second turn, dueled through the next lap and drew off in the stretch. SECRET SOULMATE raced off the pace for the opening mile, began to move up coming around the the second time, dueled around the final bend and could not go with the winner late but kept on to the finish. CARLOUN (IRE) led the way through the early going, opened up on the field the first time up the backstretch, was caught headed into the second mile and chased the top two home in the stretch. D'ARPINO B C raced off the pace through the first lap, continued into the second mile racing on the outside and was outkicked while finishing. BEOWULF (IRE) raced in the middle of the pack through the first mile, dropped back to trail the field headed into the second lap, pulled up before fence eight and walked off. THE FINAL TIME FOR THIS RACE WAS 4:00.4

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLESTON RACE 2 2 1/16M Hurdle CR: N/A. Maiden Special Weight Purse 30000. TO BE RUN OVER NATIONAL FENCES FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three-year-olds, 142 lbs.; four-year-olds, 150 lbs.; older, 154 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: OUTPERFORM led the way through the opening mile, was joined by a challenger and dueled with that rival through the next lap, dug in in the upper stretch and edged clear. IN EFFECT chased the leader the first time around, challenged headed into the second lap, dueled from there and narrowly missed. SNOW GEESE raced off the pace through the opening lap, began to improve position the second time by, made a bid approaching the quarter pole and kept on from there. MR JEFFERSON tracked the leader on the outside through the opening half mile, continued pursuit of that rival coming by the stands and was outfinished in the stretch but kept on to the finish. THE FINAL TIME FOR THIS RACE WAS 4:10.2

ENTRY.NAME: Snow Geese
ENTRY.OWNER: Riverdee Stable and Fowler Jr Joseph F

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLESTON RACE 3 2 3/8M Hurdle CR: N/A. Handicap Purse 20000. TO BE RUN OVER NATIONAL FENCES FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH ARE RATED 110 OR LOWER. The highest rated horse will be assigned 158 lbs. with all other weights adjusted accordingly based on the current ratings.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SEISMIC WAVE raced off the pace between horses through the opening mile, began to move up coming around the track the second time, challenged on the outside approaching the three eighths pole and dueled to the wire, managing to get up for the victory. OSCAR WINNER chased the pace setter on the inside through the first lap, moved up alongside that rival to duel through mile two and continued to battle to the wire to narrowly miss. DURRAGH (IRE) raced between horses through the early going, dropped back to trail the field the second time around and improved position steadily through the last half mile. NEW APPOINTMENT (IRE) raced off the pace on the outside through mile one, began a bid on the second lap and kept on from there. BOURBON DIVERSION opened up on the field in the first half mile, continued to lead the way through the second lap, was caught approaching the final turn and weakened in the lane. MARSHELLA (IRE) tracked the leader on the inside through the opening mile, continued to race inside on the second lap and faded in the stretch. MET IN MIAMI raced in the middle of the pack between horses early, began to drop back headed into the next mile, pulled up approaching fence eight and walked off. THE FINAL TIME FOR THIS RACE WAS 4:28.0

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Alston Cup S. CHARLESTON RACE 4 2 1/16M Hurdle CR: N/A. Stakes Purse 35000. TO BE RUN OVER NATIONAL FENCES FOR THREE YEAR OLDS. 148 lbs. Winners, other than claiming, 3 lbs. extra for each race won.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LIGHTNING RIDGE opened up a clear lead on the field racing through the opening half mile, continued to show the way on lap two and drew off steadily through the final mile, in command and under wraps at the wire. CLIFTON DOWN (IRE) raced outside through the early going, began a bid headed into the second lap and could not go with the winner through the final mile, chasing that rival, the best of the rest. KYOGO (IRE) raced inside through the opening lap, moved up coming around the second time and was outkicked in the final half mile. GET KHOZY trailed the field throughout, and was distanced through the final turn but still finished. THE FINAL TIME FOR THIS RACE WAS 3:59.4
